title: How to Make an Ancient Egyptian Style Ankh Necklace

steps.headline: Take your wire and bend it into the shape of an ankh.
Paper mache around the shape.
steps.description: Try to embed the jump ring in the paper mache.

steps.headline: Wait for the ankh to dry.
Paint the ankh white and wait for it to dry.
steps.description: This is to cover up the newspaper writing underneath and give the pendant a smoother finish.

steps.headline: Apply a second coat if necessary.
steps.description: Make sure the paint isn't too thin that you can see through to the white underneath, but you don't want it too thick and bulky either.

steps.headline: Once the final layer has dried, thread the chain through the jump ring.
Put it around your neck and decide what length you'd like the chain to be.
Cut the chain and add the clasp.
Done!
steps.description: Wear your necklace either with an Ancient Egyptian costume or on its own.

text: Take your wire and bend it into the shape of an ankh. See above for an image. Paper mache around the shape. Try to embed the jump ring in the paper mache. Wait for the ankh to dry.  Paint the ankh white and wait for it to dry. This is to cover up the newspaper writing underneath and give the pendant a smoother finish. Paint the ankh again (any colour).  Apply a second coat if necessary. Make sure the paint isn't too thin that you can see through to the white underneath, but you don't want it too thick and bulky either. Once the final layer has dried, thread the chain through the jump ring.  Put it around your neck and decide what length you'd like the chain to be.  Cut the chain and add the clasp.  Done! Wear your necklace either with an Ancient Egyptian costume or on its own.
